# Unlock Cloud Savings for Linux VMs with the Azure Hybrid Benefit

If you‚Äôre in IT, cloud architecture, or make decisions about your organization‚Äôs technology roadmap, finding ways to modernize infrastructure while controlling cloud costs is likely high on your agenda. The latest episode of the Azure Essentials Show, featuring Thomas Maurer and Shreya Baheti, dives into just that‚Äîexploring how the Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux enables organizations to save big while migrating mission-critical workloads to the cloud.

# What is Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux?

[Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux](https://aka.ms/AzEssentials/222/01) is a program designed to help organizations make the most of their existing Red Hat and SUSE Linux subscriptions when moving workloads to Azure. Instead of paying for a new subscription within Azure, you can bring your own and apply it directly to your Linux virtual machines (VMs). This not only streamlines migration but also delivers significant cost savings and operational flexibility.

## Why is this a big deal?

Traditionally, licensing and subscription costs can add up quickly in the cloud. Azure Hybrid Benefit ensures that you don‚Äôt pay twice for your Linux subscriptions, which means more budget for innovation and less for maintenance.

# Modernising Infrastructure and Reducing Costs

Thomas and Shreya highlight how organizations can modernize infrastructure and achieve cloud cost savings of up to 76% when combined with three-year Azure Reserved Instances by leveraging [Azure Hybrid Benefit](https://aka.ms/AHB). Modernising infrastructure isn‚Äôt just about moving to the cloud‚Äîit‚Äôs about optimising every aspect, from compute resources to licensing. By applying your existing Linux subscriptions, you unlock enterprise-grade capabilities in Azure while keeping costs under control.

## How does it work?

- Bring Your Own Subscription (BYOS): Apply your existing Red Hat or SUSE subscription to your Azure VM.
- Zero Downtime: Migrate workloads seamlessly, with no interruption to services.
- Flexible Payment Models: Choose the model that fits your organization‚Äôs needs and cashflow.

# Seamless Migration: Zero Downtime

Migrating to the cloud can feel daunting, but the Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux is designed for simplicity and continuity. You can move your Red Hat and SUSE Linux workloads to Azure with zero downtime. This means your applications stay up and running, your users remain productive, and you avoid costly outages.

# Flexible Payment Models: BYOS vs PAYG

One of the standout features discussed in the episode is the flexibility Azure offers in how you pay for your Linux subscriptions:

- Bring Your Own Subscription (BYOS): If you already have a Red Hat or SUSE subscription, you can transfer it to Azure. This is ideal for organizations with existing enterprise agreements or long-term licensing arrangements. It‚Äôs cost-effective and ensures you get the most from your current investments.
- Pay-As-You-Go (PAYG): Prefer flexibility? With PAYG, you pay only for what you use, with licensing managed directly through Azure. This model is great for organizations that want to scale up and down without upfront commitments.

Choosing between BYOS and PAYG depends on your business needs, subscription lifecycle, and budgeting strategy. Both models are designed to maximise savings and operational agility.

# Estimating Your Savings: The Azure Pricing Calculator

Curious about how much you could save? The [Azure Pricing Calculator](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/calculator/) is your go-to tool. Simply input your Linux VM specs, choose your subscription model (BYOS or PAYG), and see the potential savings in real time. The calculator makes it easy to compare options and build a business case for migration.

## Finding Documentation and Getting Started

Enabling Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux is straightforward, and Microsoft provides comprehensive documentation to guide you. For step-by-step instructions on how to activate the benefit and best practices for migration, check out the official Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux docs. You‚Äôll find practical guidance, troubleshooting tips, and contact points for support.

# Conclusion: Modernise, Save, and Succeed

The Azure Hybrid Benefit for Linux is a powerful lever for organizations looking to modernise infrastructure, save up to 76% on cloud costs, and migrate workloads without disruption. With flexible payment models, seamless migration paths, and robust documentation, it‚Äôs never been easier to unlock the full potential of the cloud for your Linux workloads.

For a deeper dive and practical insights, watch the full episode of the Azure Essentials Show with Thomas Maurer and Shreya Bahati. Take the next step in your cloud journey‚Äîmodernise, save, and succeed with Azure!
